which always accompanied any reference of hers to the Imperial family, "has declared that he will leave it to the French people themselves to choose their own form of government; and I believe that once free from the usurper, the whole nation will cer- tainly throw itself into the arms of its rightful king," she concluded, trying to be amiable to the royalist emigrant.
